discussion.content: Salesforce is planning to retire Process Visualizer with the Summer ‘19 release

comments.content:
it is definitely retired. 

"With the Summer ‘19 release, Process Visualizer will be retired. You will simply not be able to view a visual representation of approval processes using the Process Visualizer. Your data and approval processes will not be impacted, nor will the approval process information in the Approval Processes pages in Setup."
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=000321969&type=1

questions.question_text: Which action type is represented by an icon in the process visualizer? Choose 2 answers

choices.B: Are allotted extra data storage usage
choices.C: Can view documents from Content workspaces
choices.A: Are not assigned to roles in the role hierarchy

questions.question_text: Which statement is true regarding High Volume Portal users? Choose 2 answers

discussion.content:
The answer is correct.
"Unlike other users, high-volume community or site users don’t have roles, which eliminates performance issues associated with role hierarchy calculations."

High-volume users can’t own accounts."

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.networks_about_hvpu.htm&type=5

questions.question_text: What can be reviewed using the process visualizer?

comments.content: Answer is "D" only. please refer to https://success.salesforce.com/answers?id=90630000000gnghAAA

questions.question_text: Which email address option is available to override the From Email Address in a Workflow Email Alert?
Public groups can be used to simplify the creation of sharing rules for Administrators.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
True
=> https://trailhead.salesforce.com/content/learn/modules/data_security/data_security_sharing_rules
A public group is an admin-defined grouping of users that can be used to simplify the creation of sharing rules.

A public group is an admin-defined grouping of users that can be used to simplify the creation of sharing rules.
